item.description:
This event has been postponed until Sept/October.

http://nefest.com/...

Speakers announced below at bottom:

Date: Sunday, July 18, 2010
Time: 2:00pm - 8:00pm
Location: Simsbury Meadows Performing Arts
Street: 52 Iron Horse Blvd
City/Town: Simsbury, CT

http://www.nefest.com...

The New England festival event is a day of music provided by talented local country rock bands combined with political commentary in between sets. Besides our keynote speaker(s) we will have Republican candidates seeking U.S. Congressional, Senate and state seats this election year addressing the audience, a segment honoring our veterans, live internet and radio broadcasts, news coverage and both live action/slide show big screen projection.

8,000 to 10,000 seat venue.

New England Festival 2010, or NEFEST, is a celebration of our American founding principles and an expression of liberty. It is a way for people concerned with the direction our country is going to get together for an afternoon and share a day enjoying our countryâ€™s rich history with music and patriotism. It will be held on Sunday from 2PM to 8PM. Both table seats and lawn seats are available.

Premium Table Seats $35
HartfordSymphony.org

Lawn Seating $12
Ticketweb.com

Children Under 13 FREE!!
Event code: NEFEST

NEFEST ticket buyers are Republicans, Libertarians, Tea Party Patriots, Independents and Moderate Democrats who want to take back the Senate and House majorities in Washington as well as our state of CT to guide America back to what our founding fathers meant for our country to be when writing our constitution.

UPDATE on SPEAKERS:

John McManus - President John Birch Society
Dick Morris - Political Consultant
Chuck Baldwin - Presidential Candidate 2008
Garrett Lear - Patriot Pastor
item.name: New England Festival 2010 - POSTPONED!
